meanings.definition: To see or hear (an event or situation)
meanings.sent1: I was witnessing a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys witnessing the birds chirping in the morning.
meanings.sent3: Witnessing the cat chasing its tail always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood witness, witnessing the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the rainbow after the storm was truly magical.

meanings.definition: To give or serve as evidence of
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the glass were witnessing his presence.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was witnessing the cat's mischief.
meanings.sent3: The muddy footprints were witnessing the rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The empty cookie jar was witnessing the midnight snack.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face was witnessing her happiness.

meanings.definition: To testify to one's religious beliefs
meanings.sent1: He was witnessing about his faith to his friends.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of peace while witnessing about her religion.
meanings.sent3: Witnessing about his beliefs made him feel connected to his community.
meanings.sent4: The preacher was witnessing passionately to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing about her religion brought her comfort and strength.
